quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.
One joy scatters a hundred griefs.
With true friends, even water drunk together is sweet enough.
Those who wish to sing always find a song.
Happiness depends upon ourselves.
The joy of life is to love and be loved.
The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
A merry heart lives long.
The more one meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
The sun does not shine for a few trees and flowers, but for the wide world's joy.
The happiest people are those who think the most interesting thoughts.
Happiness is not perfected until it is shared.
The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.
There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures.
Blessed are those who see beautiful things in humble places where other people see nothing.
Happiness consists more in small conveniences...that occur every day than in great pieces of good fortune.
The joy of the heart is the life of man.
The joy of the spirit is the measure of its power.
A contented mind is a perpetual feast.
He is happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home.
We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
Happiness is a state of activity.
The essence of pleasure is spontaneity.
The years teach much which the days never know.
Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy.
He is the richest who is content with the least; for content is the wealth of nature.
When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive.
Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
True happiness is... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
Even in our sleep, pain which cannot be forgotten falls drop by drop upon the heart.
The darker the night, the brighter the stars.
Loneliness is the poverty of self.
The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of our adversities.
Lost time is never found again.
To weep is to lessen the depth of grief.
The remembrance of things past is not always pleasant.
The worst solitude is to be destitute of friendship.
Even the weariest river winds somewhere to the sea.
The heart was made to be broken.
A day of unhappiness is longer than a month of joy.
The bitterest tears are shed for words left unsaid.
Time, the devourer of all things.
When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
The remembrance of sorrow is also sorrowful.
Silence is true wisdom's best reply.
There is a joy in sorrow which none but a mourner can know.
Every man has his secret griefs which the world knows not.
The soul would have no rainbow if the eyes had no tears.
The tragedy of life is not death, but what dies within us while we live.
A sorrow shared is a sorrow halved.
To be forgotten is worse than death.
Grief teaches the steadiest hearts to waver.
Parting is all we know of heaven, and all we need of hell.
Time does not heal all wounds, but it teaches us to live with them.
Even silence can weep.
Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
Tears are the silent language of grief.
Every winter has its spring.
The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
The best fighter is never angry.
When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
Speak when you are angry, and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
Whatever is begun in anger ends in shame.
Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
If you kick a stone in anger, you'll hurt your own foot.
When anger rises, think of the consequences.
Anger is never without a reason, but seldom a good one.
Not the fastest horse can catch a word spoken in anger.
Beware of the anger of a patient man.
If you do not wish to be prone to anger, do not feed the habit.
He who digs a grave for his enemy might as well be digging one for himself.
A man's mouth often breaks his nose.
The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
In anger we should refrain both from speech and action.
A moment of patience...saves a thousand moments of regret.
An action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure.
When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings.
Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
He who angers you conquers you.
Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
The fire you kindle for your enemy often burns yourself more than him.
Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
The earth has music for those who listen.
The world is but a canvas to our imagination.
Curiosity is the lust of the mind.
To see a world in a grain of sand, and a heaven in a wild flower.
The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
The universe is wider than our views of it.
Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
The fairest thing we can experience is the mysterious.
Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
Joy in looking and comprehending is nature's most beautiful gift.
Nature is full of infinite causes that have never occurred in experience.
What is this life if, full of care, we have no time to stand and stare?
The miracle is not to fly in the air or to walk on the water, but to walk on the earth.
To marvel is the beginning of knowledge, and not to marvel is the loss of it.
The mountains are calling and I must go.
Wonder is the feeling of the philosopher, and philosophy begins in wonder.
The earth laughs in flowers.
The clearest way into the universe is through a forest wilderness.
The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
The poetry of the earth is never dead.
A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
There are more things in heaven and earth...than are dreamt of in your philosophy.
The true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.
Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
I would rather have a mind opened by wonder than one closed by belief.
He who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead.
Be as playful as a child, for in play is true freedom.
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
He who laughs, lasts.
Men do not quit playing because they grow old; they grow old because they quit playing.
The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
Whistle while you work.
Laugh, and the world laughs with you.
A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age.
In every work of genius we recognize our own rejected thoughts.
The most effective kind of education is that a child should play among lovely things.
Man is most nearly himself when he achieves the seriousness of a child at play.
Children find everything in nothing; men find nothing in everything.
Play, so you may be serious.
Be silly, be honest, be kind.
The happiness of life is made up of little things...
A hearty laugh is good medicine.
Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.
A little nonsense now and then, is cherished by the wisest men.
You can't be serious all the time.
If you obey all the rules, you miss all the fun.
The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
Life is too important to be taken seriously.
I am not young enough to know everything.
A day without laughter is a day wasted.
I have a simple taste, only the best.
Modesty is the crown of character.
Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
Still waters run deep.
The silent man is the best to listen to.
A gentle hand may lead even an elephant by a hair.
A quiet spirit brings peace to the home.
A gentle word opens an iron gate.
Humility is the solid foundation of all virtues.
The tree that bends with the wind will outlast the storm.
A kind word is like a spring day.
The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
Patience is stronger than the sword.
A whisper may be louder than a shout.
The rose is sweetest when it opens slowly.
To know when to be silent is wisdom.
He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened.
Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
Soft words are strong arguments.
Kindness is the highest wisdom.
Humility is the foundation of honor.
Nothing is so strong as gentleness, and nothing is so gentle as real strength.
It is the weak who are cruel. Gentleness can only be expected from the strong.
There is a quiet dignity in simplicity.
Gentleness is the antidote for cruelty.
In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
A word of kindness is seldom spoken in vain.
The best portion of a good man's life is his little nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
He that can have patience can have what he will.
All human wisdom is summed up in two words: wait and hope.
The stream passes on, but the rock remains.
The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
A stumble may prevent a fall.
If every rub irritates you, how will you be polished?
Our patience will achieve more than our force.
Step by step the ladder is climbed.
Endurance is nobler than strength.
Fall seven times and stand up eight.
Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
The reed that bends does not break.
Have patience. All things are difficult before they are easy.
Genius is eternal patience.
Patience is the key to paradise.
Endurance conquers all things.
Rome was not built in a day.
Constant dripping wears away the stone.
With time and patience, the mulberry leaf becomes a silk gown.
A handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains.
Slow and steady wins the race.
The greatest victory is to master yourself.
The obstacle is the path.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
The secret of patience is to do something else in the meantime.
Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.
Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
Do the thing you fear, and the death of fear is certain.
He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
In time we hate that which we often fear.
Fear is a poor guide.
Cowards die many times before their deaths; the valiant never taste of death but once.
There is no illusion greater than fear.
Nothing is terrible except fear itself.
Suspicion is the companion of mean souls.
Courage is mastery of fear-not its absence.
The thing most feared is often least harmful.
To the anxious, every leaf rustles.
Nothing is so much to be feared as fear itself.
He who fears defeat is already half defeated.
Fortune favors the brave.
Hope and fear walk hand in hand.
An uneasy mind is its own punishment.
He who expects suffering suffers it twice.
The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty.
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer.
Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
To fear is one thing. To let fear grab you by the tail and swing you around is another.
The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
Of all the liars in the world, sometimes the worst are our own fears.
You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
Fear is static that prevents me from hearing myself.
Fear is a darkroom where negatives develop.
Don't be afraid of your fears. They're not there to scare you. They're there to let you know that something is worth it.
Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
When the mind is calm, the world is gentle.
A quiet heart is richer than a full purse.
Calmness is the cradle of power.
No man is free who is not a master of himself.
Harmony makes small things grow.
Contentment is natural wealth.
The calmer you are, the clearer you see.
He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the world.
A calm sea reflects the sky.
Peace is liberty in tranquility.
To live well is to live calmly.
He who does not desire power is most fit to hold it.
Serenity is not freedom from the storm, but peace within it.
To be satisfied with little is the greatest wealth.
Rest is the sweet sauce of labor.
Harmony is the melody of life.
There never was a good war or a bad peace.
The calm stream runs the longest.
If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
The life of inner peace, being harmonious and without stress, is the easiest type of existence.
Do not let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.
Peace is always beautiful.
You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.
Peace is the only battle worth waging.
Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
When you make peace with yourself, you make peace with the world.
Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
